House Bill/Resolution NO. HB07943
FULL TITLE : AN ACT TO EXPAND THE COVERAGE OF MICRO ENTERPRISES AS BENEFICIARIES OF THE MAGNA CARTA FOR MICRO, SMALL, AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES OR REPUBLIC ACT NO. 6977, AS AMENDED BY REPUBLIC ACT NO. 8289 AND FURTHER AMENDED BY REPUBLIC ACT NO. 9501
ABSTRACT : Amends existing laws on Magna Carta for Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises specifically MSMEs categories based on total assets in order to ensure that more businesses are qualified to enjoy the benefits of specialized programs for the said sector. Provides that Sec.3 of Republic Act No. 6977, as amended by Republic Act Nos. 8289 and 9501, is hereby amended to read as follows: MSMEs shall be defined as any business activity or enterprise engaged in industry, agribusiness, and/or services … whose total assets … must have value falling under the following categories: Micro: not more than [3,000,000] P7,500,000 Small: [P3,000,001 – P15,000,000] P7,500,001 – P15,000,000 Medium: [P15,000,001 – P100,000,000] P15,000,001 – P100,000,000.
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : VARGAS, ALFRED D.
DATE FILED : 2018-07-23
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL

ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE
COMMITEE HEARINGS/ACTIONS:
      1. Deliberated upon by the Mother Committee on 2018-09-19
          -Rep. Teodoro Montoro sponsored the said bill on behalf of the author. The bill intends to amend the definition of micro and small enterprises, as follows: • micro - from an asset size of not more than P3 Million, to an asset size of not more than P7.5 Million • small - from an asset size of P3,000,001-P15 Million, to an asset size of P7,500,001- P15 Million Majority of the agencies, namely, the Department of Trade and Industry, Department of Science and Technology, Department of Agriculture, Department of Finance, Small Business Corporation, Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas, and Philippine Exporters Confederation (PHILEXPORT) want to retain the current definition of MSMEs. Only Ka-Entrep Micro and Small Organization of the Philippines welcomed the proposal to amend the definition. In view thereof, HB 7943 will not be consolidated with HBs 4498 and 5540.
      2. Tabled by the Committee on 2018-10-10
          -Rep. Teodoro Montoro sponsored the said bill on behalf of the author. The bill intends to amend the definition of micro and small enterprises, as follows: • micro - from an asset size of not more than P3 Million, to an asset size of not more than P7.5 Million • small - from an asset size of P3,000,001-P15 Million, to an asset size of P7,500,001- P15 Million Majority of the agencies, namely, the Department of Trade and Industry, Department of Science and Technology, Department of Agriculture, Department of Finance, Small Business Corporation, Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas, and Philippine Exporters Confederation (PHILEXPORT) want to retain the current definition of MSMEs. Only Ka-Entrep Micro and Small Organization of the Philippines welcomed the proposal to amend the definition. In view thereof, HB 7943 will not be consolidated with HBs 4498 and 5540.
          -• Received by CSBED on August 08, 2018. • Initial deliberation on the bill was conducted on September 25, 2018. • The author was informed through a letter dated October 10, 2018 that the said measure will be automatically tabled since majority of the stakeholders expressed that they are not in favor of the proposed reclassification.
